content.description: Crux down low with little to no pro on poor quality rock.  On TR some rock broke off so best to do this as a TR problem
content.protection: Book says Pro to 2".  However down low falling would not be wise as pro is inadequate and rock is poor quality
content.location:
Route is the arête left of

Fryer Flyers

.

content.description: a nice hand crack - worth doing
content.location: right of the center of the formation

climbs.name: Pitch Black
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Dave Evans, and Marge Floyd, Oct. 1989

content.description: finger and hand jamming with knobs
content.location: near the center of the formation

climbs.name: Pacific Heights
climbs.fa: (TR) Warren Hughes, October 1990; First lead: Todd Swain, October 1991 (solo)

content.description:
Start off a large grey knob and climb the face parallel to

Pacific Avenue Dorm

.
content.location:
Just right of

Pacific Avenue Dorm

.

climbs.name: Pacific Avenue Dorm
climbs.fa: Warren Hughes and Mike Van Volkem, Oct. 1990

content.description: an excellent clean steep face with good protection.  It is on a north-facing wall, and is usually in the shade
content.protection: 3 bolts plus gear for the anchor
content.location: a short, pocketed north-facing wall, around the corner to the right of Chicken Mechanics.  It starts most of the way up the formation.

climbs.name: My Friends Treat Me Like a Mushroom
climbs.fa: Bill Cramer, Michelle Cramer & Mike Shacklett, November 1992

content.description: An OK route that makes a good warm-up. Start in the low-angle slot on good rock and good pro to go up to a small shrub on the climb.  Look right to see a bolt on the face to the right and clip that.  Climb up and right past that bolt (crux) to continue up the face, wandering around for the best holds and eventually left, for the second bolt and finish, or to the right to join Chicken Mechanics (more trad gear).  The route is a reasonable warm up and fin overall.
content.protection: A standard trad rack with some longer runners and a few bolts to clip.  If you stay right after the first bolt and join Chicken Mechanics, it takes more gear, so double cams are optional.
content.location: Just left of the base of Chicken Mechanics, there is a right facing corner that contains a low angle slot.  The route starts in this slot.

content.description: Start about 100 feet left of Blackout on a separate formation that faces the road. Climb a left facing corner/crack system past the left edge of a ceiling to the top.
content.location:
Start about 100 feet left of

Blackout

on a separate formation that faces the road.

content.description: a fairly nice, runout face climb that gets morning sun  The bulge at the bottom is apparently 5.11, and not on the route.
content.location: to the right of Pitch Black

content.description: A so-so hand crack. This route gets little or no morning sun.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of Poultry Pilots.

climbs.name: Chicken Mechanics
climbs.fa: Brian Sillasen and Todd Gordon, May 1986

content.description: This route has a fun crux overhang with a clean finger crack above.
content.location: to the right of the center of the formation

climbs.name: Blackout
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Rick Guerrieri and Dave Evans, October 1989

content.description:
This along with

Blackheart

are located on the nice looking "3-tiered" face on the far left side of the Ken Black formation. Easily visible from the road. This is the righthand line passing a couple of bolts to a two bolt anchor/rap
content.protection: Couple of cams to go with the bolts.

climbs.name: Blackjack
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines, Todd Gordon, Yvonne Gaines, December 1995

content.description: 7 bolt sport climb between Pitch Black and Holiday in the Sun.
content.location: Southeast facing. Morning to midday sun, late afternoon shade.

climbs.name: Blackheart
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Alan Bartlett, March 1997

content.description:
This along with

Blackout

are located on the nice looking "3-tiered" face on the far left side of the Ken Black formation.  Easily visible from the road.  This is the lefthand line passing a couple of bolts to a two bolt anchor/rap
content.protection: A few cams and bolts, 2 bolt anchor/rap

content.description: Go up the stair like blocks until you can bust out right onto the first good patina you see.  Head up and right to a high first bolt.  A couple of grainy step ups will get you to the next bolt.  Trend left and up into a layback crack.  Pro might be available in the horizontals and the crack.  A cleaner top out is the crack just to the right that is Blackheart.
content.protection: Two bolts to a shared two bolt anchor with Blackheart.
content.location: Start in the gully at the far left end of the crag on some stair like blocks.
